text: The Brigantes were a British Celtic tribe (people), that used to live in the North of Roman Britain; between the rivers Tyne and Humber. They occupied what was later Northumbria.David Hughes, The British Chronicles, Volume 1 (Westminster, MD: Heritage Books, 2007), p. 78 To the north was the territory of the Votadini, which straddled the present day border between England and Scotland. ==Nearby tribes== The tribes that used to live next to the Brigantes were the Carvetti, the Parisii, the Cornovii, and the Corieltauvi. ==Related tribes== There was a Brigantes tribe who used to live in the South of Ireland as well. They may both be related to the Brigantii of the eastern Alps. == Other websites == * Brigantes Nation * Brigantes at Roman-Britain.co.uk * Brigantes at Romans in Britain == References == Category:History of the United Kingdom Category:Celtic peoples
title: Brigantes
